Shadow giants are fierce natives of the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11), where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia. Their cultures vary greatly depending on whether the giants reside in their land of origin or have relocated to the Material Plane. On the Shadow Plane, they live in familiar groups and uphold a nomadic way of life as they roam across ancestral lands between shadowy forests and misty chasms. These hunter-gatherers pass down lore through oral histories, conduct pilgrimages to unholy ziggurats of black stone, and bathe in the blood of their long-standing foes, including rival shadow giant clans and velstracs intent on enslaving their kind. On the Material Plane, conversely, they are secretive and isolationist, keeping apart from other peoples in forbidding structures of black stone in high, isolated mountain valleys. Standing 15 feet tall, with gray skin and hair only a shade lighter, shadow giants are fearsome foes with a well-earned reputation as zealous warmongers and ruthless combatants. They rarely interact with outsiders, though they may treat with proven warriors who show the giants the respect and deference they feel they deserve. Only a small subset of shadow giants worship [Zon-Kuthon](/Deities.aspx?ID=20), and most of these Kuthites are so firmly entrenched in the culture of Nidal that their Shadow Plane-dwelling kin would hardly recognize them. Most shadow giants instead practice an ancient religion, unique to their people, with its own bloody themes of sacrifice and self-mutilation. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 31 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 [Shadow Giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=681) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 127 2.0, [Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn](/Sources.aspx?ID=8) pg. 79 **Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8), [Shadowtongue](/Languages.aspx?ID=21) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +21 **Str** +8 **Dex** +2 **Con** +5 **Int** +0 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +3 **Items** _+1 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=10)_, [sack with 5 rocks](/Equipment.aspx?ID=45), _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [spiked chain](/Weapons.aspx?ID=60)_ --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +20 **Will** +23 **HP** 275 **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)**
**[Catch Rock](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=7)** --- **Speed** 35 feet **Melee** _spiked chain _+27 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 3d8+18 slashing plus pall of shadow **Melee** fist +26 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+18 bludgeoning plus pall of shadow **Ranged** rock +26 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 2d8+18 bludgeoning **Pall of Shadow** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) When a shadow giant hits with a melee Strike, the target must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) and take a –1 status penalty to Perception checks involving sight as long as they remain drained. On a critical failure, this condition doesn't heal naturally and can be removed only with magic. **Shadowcloak** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) The shadow giant becomes shrouded in shadows and becomes [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4). As the nature of this effect leaves the giant's location obvious, it can't use this concealment to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62) or [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63). This effect lasts for 1 minute or until it is exposed to direct sunlight, whichever comes first. **[Throw Rock](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=38)**
Shadow Giant Locations Some shadow giants travel to the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) to serve as agents in Nidal's Umbral Court. Rumors of these massive shock troops deployed by the court's mysterious members are common, and such rumors often place them in the mountains near Cheliax and Molthune.
Umbral Court Agents Some shadow giants travel to the Material Plane specifically to serve as agents in Nidal’s Umbral Court. One needs not stalk the streets of Pangolais or Nisroch for long to hear rumors of the massive shock troops deployed by the court’s mysterious members.
